article:
Morbius (film)
================

Morbius is a 2022 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name. The film is directed by Daniel Espinosa and written by Matt Sazama and Burk Sharpless. It is the third film in Sony Pictures' Spider-Man Universe and stars Jared Leto as the titular character, alongside Matt Smith, Adria Arjona, Jared Harris, Al Madrigal, and Tyrese Gibson.

Plot
=====

The film follows the story of Michael Morbius (Jared Leto), a brilliant scientist suffering from a rare blood disorder. Desperate for a cure, Morbius turns to an experimental treatment that combines human and bat DNA. While the treatment is successful in curing his disorder, it also has an unexpected side effect: Morbius develops a set of vampiric characteristics, including superhuman strength, agility, and the ability to fly.

As Morbius struggles to come to terms with his new condition, he becomes the target of a series of attacks by a mysterious figure. The figure is revealed to be Milo (Matt Smith), a wealthy and charismatic individual who also suffers from the same blood disorder as Morbius. Milo becomes obsessed with Morbius's newfound abilities and seeks to replicate the treatment for himself.

As the story unfolds, Morbius finds himself caught in a battle between his own humanity and his emerging vampiric nature. He must also confront the consequences of his actions and the danger that Milo poses to those around him.

Cast
=====

* Jared Leto as Michael Morbius
* Matt Smith as Milo
* Adria Arjona as Martine Bancroft
* Jared Harris as Emil Nikos
* Al Madrigal as Alberto Rodriguez
* Tyrese Gibson as Simon Stroud

Production
==========

### Development

Development on Morbius began in 2017, with Matt Sazama and Burk Sharpless writing the screenplay. The film was initially intended to be part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), but it was later revealed that it would be part of Sony Pictures' Spider-Man Universe instead.

In June 2018, Daniel Espinosa was announced as the director of the film. Jared Leto was cast as the titular character in September 2018, with Matt Smith joining the cast in January 2019.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on Morbius began in February 2019, with filming scheduled to start in April. The film's budget was estimated to be around $75 million.

In March 2019, it was announced that Adria Arjona had joined the cast as Martine Bancroft, a scientist and love interest of Morbius. Jared Harris and Al Madrigal were also cast in supporting roles.

### Filming

Principal photography on Morbius began on April 1, 2019, in Manchester, England. Filming took place in various locations throughout the United Kingdom, including London and Newcastle.

In May 2019, it was reported that filming had been halted due to a scheduling conflict with Jared Leto. Filming resumed in June 2019 and wrapped up in July.

### Post-production

Post-production on Morbius began in July 2019, with the film's visual effects being handled by Moving Picture Company (MPC). The film's score was composed by Jon Ekstrand and Ludwig Göransson.

In September 2020, it was announced that the film's release had been delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The film was eventually released on April 1, 2022.

Music
=====

The score for Morbius was composed by Jon Ekstrand and Ludwig Göransson. The soundtrack features a mix of electronic and orchestral elements, with a focus on dark and atmospheric soundscapes.

Marketing
=========

The marketing campaign for Morbius began in July 2020, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured Jared Leto as Morbius, with a focus on the character's vampiric abilities.

In October 2020, a second trailer was released, featuring more action sequences and a glimpse of the film's villain, Milo. The trailer also featured a nod to the Marvel Comics universe, with a reference to the character of Spider-Man.

Release
=======

### Theatrical

Morbius was released in theaters on April 1, 2022. The film was initially intended to be released in July 2020, but it was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

The film received a mixed response from critics, with some praising Jared Leto's performance and others criticizing the film's plot and pacing.

### Home media

Morbius was released on digital platforms on May 17, 2022, and on Blu-ray and DVD on June 14, 2022. The home media release features a number of bonus features, including deleted scenes and a behind-the-scenes documentary.

Reception
==========

### Box office

Morbius grossed $163 million worldwide, with $73 million of that coming from the United States. The film's box office performance was considered disappointing, given its estimated budget of $75 million.

### Critical response

Morbius received a mixed response from critics, with some praising Jared Leto's performance and others criticizing the film's plot and pacing. The film holds a 17% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 213 reviews.

On Metacritic, the film has a score of 35 out of 100, based on 53 reviews. Some critics praised the film's visuals and action sequences, while others criticized its storytelling and character development.

### Internet memes

Morbius became the subject of a number of internet memes, with many fans poking fun at the film's plot and characters. The film's villain, Milo, became a particular target of mockery, with many fans comparing him to a " Tumblr villain".

Future
======

In April 2022, it was announced that a sequel to Morbius was in development, with Jared Leto set to reprise his role as the titular character. The sequel is expected to explore more of the Marvel Comics universe, with a potential crossover with other Sony Pictures' Spider-Man Universe films.

Notes

* The film's villain, Milo, is a nod to the Marvel Comics character of the same name, who first appeared in The Amazing Spider-Man #101.

The 2023 Australian Open was a Grand Slam tennis tournament that took place at Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Australia, from January 16 to January 29, 2023. It was the 111th edition of the Australian Open and the first Grand Slam of the 2023 tennis season. The tournament featured a range of events, including singles, doubles, and wheelchair competitions, as well as junior and exhibition matches.

Singles players

The 2023 Australian Open saw a strong field of singles players, with several top-ranked players competing in the tournament. In the men's singles competition, Novak Djokovic and Daniil Medvedev were among the top seeds, while Ashleigh Barty and Naomi Osaka led the women's singles field.

The men's singles competition at the 2023 Australian Open was won by Novak Djokovic, who defeated Stefanos Tsitsipas in the final. article:
Nahel Merzouk Riots

The Nahel Merzouk riots were a series of civil disturbances that took place in France in June and July 2023, following the killing of Nahel Merzouk, a 17-year-old French teenager of Algerian descent, by a police officer during a traffic stop. The riots, which began in the Paris suburb of Nanterre, spread to other parts of metropolitan France and overseas territories, resulting in widespread property damage, injuries, and arrests.

# Background

## Killing of Nahel Merzouk

On June 27, 2023, Nahel Merzouk was shot and killed by a police officer during a traffic stop in the Paris suburb of Nanterre. Merzouk was driving a car with three other passengers when the police officer pulled them over. According to eyewitnesses, the officer opened fire on the vehicle after Merzouk allegedly tried to flee the scene. Merzouk died shortly after arrival at the hospital. The incident sparked widespread outrage and protests in the community, with many accusing the police of racial profiling and brutality.

## 2017 law concerning traffic stops

In 2017, France passed a law that allowed police officers to use their discretion when conducting traffic stops. The law was intended to reduce the number of checks on minority communities, who were disproportionately targeted by police. However, critics argued that the law did not go far enough to address the issue of racial profiling and that it gave police officers too much leeway to discriminate.

## Civil unrest related to policing

The Nahel Merzouk riots were not an isolated incident of civil unrest related to policing in France. In recent years, there have been several high-profile cases of police brutality and racial profiling that have sparked protests and riots. In 2020, the French government passed a law that restricted the right to film police officers, which was widely criticized as an attempt to cover up police misconduct.

## Police brutality in France

Police brutality is a long-standing issue in France, with many cases of excessive force and violence against minority communities. In 2019, the French government was forced to apologize for the beating of a black man by police officers, which was caught on camera. The incident sparked widespread outrage and calls for greater accountability and reform within the police force.

## Racial profiling and false reporting

Racial profiling is a systemic issue within the French police force, with many officers accused of targeting minority communities. In 2020, a report by the French National Consultative Commission on Human Rights found that people of North African and African descent were 20 times more likely to be stopped by police than white people. The report also found that many police officers falsified reports to justify discriminatory stops.

## Social problems

The Nahel Merzouk riots were also a symptom of deeper social problems in France, including poverty, unemployment, and social exclusion. Many of the communities affected by the riots were already struggling with high levels of poverty and unemployment, and the killing of Merzouk was seen as a spark that ignited long-simmering tensions.

# Events

## Metropolitan France

### 27–28 June

The riots began on June 27, 2023, in the Paris suburb of Nanterre, where Merzouk was killed. Protesters clashed with police, who used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. The riots quickly spread to other parts of the city, including the suburbs of Saint-Denis and Aubervilliers.

### 29–30 June

On June 29, 2023, the riots intensified, with protesters setting fire to cars and buildings. The police responded with force, using water cannons and batons to disperse the crowd. The riots continued throughout the night, with many areas of the city affected.

### 1–2 July

On July 1, 2023, the riots spread to other parts of France, including the cities of Lyon and Marseille. Protesters clashed with police, who used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. The riots continued throughout the night, with many areas of the city affected.

### 3–4 July

On July 3, 2023, the riots reached their peak, with protesters setting fire to buildings and cars. The police responded with force, using water cannons and batons to disperse the crowd. The riots continued throughout the night, with many areas of the city affected.

### 8 July

On July 8, 2023, the riots began to subside, with many areas of the city returning to normal. However, tensions remained high, with many protesters vowing to continue their campaign for justice.

### 10 July

On July 10, 2023, a memorial service was held for Nahel Merzouk, with many protesters and community leaders in attendance. The service was a peaceful and emotional tribute to Merzouk, with many calling for justice and reform.

## Overseas France

The Nahel Merzouk riots also affected several overseas territories of France, including Guadeloupe and Martinique. Protesters clashed with police, who used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd. The riots continued throughout the night, with many areas of the city affected.

## International

The Nahel Merzouk riots received international attention, with many countries condemning the police violence and calling for reform. The United Nations issued a statement expressing concern about the situation, while the European Union called for a full investigation into the killing of Merzouk.

# Damage to cultural sites

The Nahel Merzouk riots resulted in significant damage to cultural sites, including museums, libraries, and historical landmarks. Many of these sites were targeted by protesters, who saw them as symbols of the French state and its institutions.

# Estimated cost of the riots

The estimated cost of the Nahel Merzouk riots is difficult to quantify, but it is believed to be in the hundreds of millions of euros. Many businesses were affected, with property damage and loss of revenue. The cost of policing and emergency services also added to the total.

# Reactions

## Public officials and media

Public officials and media outlets were quick to condemn the riots, with many calling for calm and restraint. However, many protesters felt that the government and media were not taking their concerns seriously, and that they were being demonized and stigmatized.

## Police violence

The police response to the riots was widely criticized, with many accusing officers of using excessive force and violence. Many protesters were injured, and some were arrested and charged with crimes.

## Police revolt

In the aftermath of the riots, some police officers began to speak out against the government and the police leadership, accusing them of not providing adequate support and resources. The police revolt was a symptom of deeper tensions within the police force, with many officers feeling that they were being scapegoated for the government's failures.

## Misinformation

During the riots, there was widespread misinformation and disinformation, with many false reports and rumors circulating on social media. Many protesters and community leaders were accused of spreading false information, while others were accused of manipulating the narrative to suit their own agendas.

article:
WrestleMania 39
================

WrestleMania 39 was the 39th annual WrestleMania professional wrestling event produced by WWE. It took place on April 1 and 2, 2023, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California.

Production
------------

### Background

WrestleMania 39 was announced on April 3, 2022, during WrestleMania 38. The event marked the third time SoFi Stadium hosted WrestleMania, following WrestleMania 37 and WrestleMania 38's Night 1. Tickets for the event went on sale on July 22, 2022.

### Broadcast outlets

WrestleMania 39 was available to stream on Peacock in the United States and on the WWE Network internationally. The event was also available to purchase on traditional pay-per-view (PPV) in some countries.

### Celebrity involvement

Several celebrities made appearances during WrestleMania 39, including Snoop Dogg, who presented the 24/7 Championship, and Simu Liu, who was in attendance for the event.

### Other WrestleMania Week events

Several events took place during WrestleMania Week, including the 2023 WWE Hall of Fame ceremony, which honored the class of 2023, and NXT Stand & Deliver, a NXT event that took place on March 31, 2023.

### Promotional movie parodies

WWE released several promotional movie parodies in the lead-up to WrestleMania 39, including parodies of Top Gun: Maverick and Creed III.

### Storylines

#### Main event matches

The main event of Night 1 featured Kevin Owens and Sami Zayn facing The Usos for the Undisputed WWE Tag Team Championship. The two teams had a long-standing feud, with Owens and Zayn seeking to finally capture the titles.

The 2023–24 FA Cup qualifying rounds will determine the teams that join the 32 teams that have qualified from the 2022–23 EFL Championship and the 20 teams that have qualified from the 2022–23 Premier League to form the 124 teams that will compete in the 2023–24 FA Cup first round proper.

# Eligibility

The competition is open to all clubs that have gained membership with the Football Association (FA) and compete in the National League System (NLS), which comprises the top eight tiers of the English football league system, from the National League (level 5) down to the various County Football Leagues (level 11). Clubs that compete in the NLS are eligible to enter the competition, but those with a higher standing may be exempt from the need to compete in some or all of the qualifying rounds.

# Calendar

The 2023–24 FA Cup qualifying rounds will take place as follows:

* Extra preliminary round: August 2023
* Preliminary round: August 2023
* First qualifying round: September 2023

article:
2022 Pennsylvania Gubernatorial Election

The 2022 Pennsylvania gubernatorial election took place on November 8, 2022, to elect the Governor of Pennsylvania. The election was held concurrently with other elections in the state, including the election for Lieutenant Governor, U.S. Senate, and U.S. House of Representatives.

#Democratic primary

##Governor

###Campaign

The Democratic primary campaign for governor began in 2021, with several candidates announcing their intentions to run. The primary was seen as a crowded and competitive contest, with multiple candidates vying for the nomination.

###Candidates

####Nominee

Josh Shapiro, the Attorney General of Pennsylvania, won the Democratic primary for governor. Shapiro was endorsed by several prominent Democrats, including Governor Tom Wolf and Senator Bob Casey.

####Failed to qualify for ballot access

Several candidates failed to qualify for ballot access, including Pittsburgh Mayor Bill Peduto and businessman Kyle Mullins.

####Declined

Several potential candidates declined to run, including Philadelphia Mayor Jim Kenney and U.S. Representative Conor Lamb.

###Endorsements

Shapiro received endorsements from several prominent Democrats, including Governor Tom Wolf, Senator Bob Casey, and U.S. Representative Matt Cartwright.

###Results

The Democratic primary election took place on May 17, 2022. Shapiro won the primary with 53.1% of the vote, followed by businessman Joe Torsella with 31.4%.

##Lieutenant governor

###Candidates

####Nominee

Austin Davis, a state representative from Allegheny County, won the Democratic primary for lieutenant governor. Davis was endorsed by several prominent Democrats, including Governor Tom Wolf and Senator Bob Casey.

####Eliminated in primary

Several candidates were eliminated in the primary, including state Representative Malcolm Kenyatta and Chester County Commissioner Marian Moskowitz.

####Declined

Several potential candidates declined to run, including Pittsburgh City Councilman Corey O'Connor and state Representative Kevin Boyle.

####Withdrew

State Representative Mark Rozzi withdrew from the primary in April 2022.

###Endorsements

Davis received endorsements from several prominent Democrats, including Governor Tom Wolf, Senator Bob Casey, and U.S. Representative Matt Cartwright.

###Results

The Democratic primary election for lieutenant governor took place on May 17, 2022. Davis won the primary with 63.2% of the vote, followed by state Representative Malcolm Kenyatta with 21.1%.

#Republican primary

##Governor

###Candidates

####Nominee

Doug Mastriano, a state senator from Franklin County, won the Republican primary for governor. Mastriano was endorsed by former President Donald Trump.

####Eliminated in primary

Several candidates were eliminated in the primary, including businessman Dave White, former U.S. Representative Melissa Hart, and state Representative Charlie Gerow.

####Withdrew

Several candidates withdrew from the primary, including state Senator Jake Corman and former U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain.

####Declined

Several potential candidates declined to run, including U.S. Senator Pat Toomey and U.S. Representative Mike Kelly.

###Debates and forums

Several debates and forums were held during the primary campaign, including a debate hosted by the Republican State Committee.

###Endorsements

Mastriano received an endorsement from former President Donald Trump.

###Polling

Mastriano led in the polls throughout the primary campaign.

###Results

The Republican primary election took place on May 17, 2022. Mastriano won the primary with 44.1% of the vote, followed by businessman Dave White with 24.7%.

##Lieutenant governor

###Candidates

####Nominee

Carrie DelRosso, a state representative from Allegheny County, won the Republican primary for lieutenant governor.

####Eliminated in primary

Several candidates were eliminated in the primary, including state Representative Russ Diamond and businessman Teddy Daniels.

###Declined

Several potential candidates declined to run, including state Senator Kim Ward and U.S. Representative Lloyd Smucker.

###Endorsements

DelRosso received endorsements from several prominent Republicans, including state Senator Jake Corman and U.S. Representative Mike Kelly.

###Results

The Republican primary election for lieutenant governor took place on May 17, 2022. DelRosso won the primary with 51.1% of the vote, followed by state Representative Russ Diamond with 29.4%.

#Libertarian nomination

##Governor

###Nominee

Matt Hackenburg, a Libertarian activist, won the Libertarian nomination for governor.

###Eliminated in board vote

Several candidates were eliminated in a board vote, including businessman Erik Gerhardt.

###Withdrew

Several candidates withdrew from the nomination process, including Libertarian activist Kevin Gaughen.

##Lieutenant governor

###Nominee

Tim McMaster, a Libertarian activist, won the Libertarian nomination for lieutenant governor.

###Withdrew

Several candidates withdrew from the nomination process, including Libertarian activist Jennifer Moore.

#Green convention

##Governor

###Nominee

Christina Hartman, a Green Party activist, won the Green Party nomination for governor.

###Withdrew

Several candidates withdrew from the nomination process, including Green Party activist Neal Gale.

##Lieutenant governor

###Nominee

Michael Bagdes-Canning, a Green Party activist, won the Green Party nomination for lieutenant governor.

#Keystone nomination

##Governor

###Nominee

Joe Soloski, a Keystone Party activist, won the Keystone Party nomination for governor.

###Withdrew

Several candidates withdrew from the nomination process, including Keystone Party activist Paul Glover.

##Lieutenant governor

###Nominee

Christine Welker, a Keystone Party activist, won the Keystone Party nomination for lieutenant governor.

#General election

##Campaign

The general election campaign began after the primary elections. Shapiro and Mastriano faced off in a series of debates and forums.

##Predictions

Several organizations predicted the outcome of the election, including the Cook Political Report and the Rothenberg Political Report.

##Endorsements

Shapiro received endorsements from several prominent organizations, including the Pennsylvania AFL-CIO and the Sierra Club. Mastriano received an endorsement from the National Rifle Association.

##Fundraising

Shapiro raised significantly more money than Mastriano throughout the campaign.

##Polling

Shapiro led in the polls throughout the campaign.

##Results

The general election took place on November 8, 2022. Shapiro won the election with 56.5% of the vote, followed by Mastriano with 41.6%.

##By county

Shapiro won 26 counties, while Mastriano won 46 counties.

###By congressional district

Shapiro won 9 congressional districts, while Mastriano won 13 congressional districts.

#Analysis

##Voter demographics

The election saw a significant turnout of voters from urban areas, with Shapiro performing well in cities such as Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

article:
Ballona Creek Bike Path

The Ballona Creek Bike Path is a 6.4-mile (10.3 km) Class I bicycle path in Los Angeles County, California, that runs along Ballona Creek. The path is a popular route for commuters and recreational cyclists, providing a scenic and relatively flat route through the city.

# Route

The Ballona Creek Bike Path begins at the intersection of Centinela Avenue and Braddock Drive in Del Rey, near the Los Angeles International Airport (LAX). From there, it follows the Ballona Creek channel north through the cities of Los Angeles, Culver City, and Marina del Rey, before ending at the Marvin Braude Bike Trail (also known as "The Strand") in Playa del Rey.

## Airport

The bike path's proximity to LAX makes it a convenient option for cyclists traveling to or from the airport. However, cyclists should be aware that the path does not provide direct access to the airport terminals. Instead, it connects to the airport's perimeter roads, allowing cyclists to access the airport's bike parking facilities or connect to other local bike routes.

# Conditions

The Ballona Creek Bike Path is generally well-maintained and suitable for cyclists of all skill levels. However, there are some conditions that cyclists should be aware of:

## Rest stops

There are several rest stops and parks along the bike path, providing cyclists with opportunities to rest, picnic, or use public restrooms. Some of these parks also offer drinking fountains, bike racks, and other amenities.

## Homeless camping

Unfortunately, the Ballona Creek Bike Path has struggled with issues related to homeless camping in recent years. In some areas, homeless individuals have set up campsites along the bike path, which can create safety concerns and unsanitary conditions for cyclists and local residents. Efforts have been made to address these issues, including increased police presence and outreach services to connect homeless individuals with social services.

# Access gates

The Ballona Creek Bike Path has several access gates that allow cyclists to enter or exit the path at various points. These gates are designed to prevent motorized vehicles from entering the path, while allowing cyclists and pedestrians to pass through. However, some of these gates can be narrow or have limited visibility, so cyclists should exercise caution when approaching them.

# History

The Ballona Creek Bike Path was first proposed in the 1970s as part of a larger effort to develop recreational facilities along the Ballona Creek channel. The path was constructed in several phases, with the first section opening in the early 1980s. Since then, the path has undergone several improvements and expansions, including the addition of new access gates, rest stops, and landscaping.

# Improvements

In recent years, the Ballona Creek Bike Path has undergone several improvements aimed at enhancing safety and accessibility. These improvements have included:

* Resurfacing and widening of the path to improve visibility and reduce conflicts between cyclists and pedestrians
* Installation of new signage and striping to clarify path markings and reduce confusion
* Addition of new access gates and rest stops to improve access and amenities for cyclists
* Enhanced landscaping and habitat restoration to improve the path's scenic and environmental qualities

# Proposed extensions

There are several proposed extensions to the Ballona Creek Bike Path, aimed at connecting the path to other local bike routes and improving access to surrounding communities. Some of these proposed extensions include:

* A connection to the Expo Line bike path, which would provide a direct link to downtown Los Angeles and other regional bike routes
* An extension to the San Gabriel River Trail, which would provide a link to the San Gabriel Mountains and other regional bike routes
* An extension to the Marvin Braude Bike Trail, which would provide a direct link to the beachfront bike path in Santa Monica and other surrounding communities

article:
2023 Turkey–Syria Earthquakes

On February 6, 2023, a series of devastating earthquakes struck southern Turkey and northern Syria, causing widespread destruction and loss of life. The earthquakes were among the deadliest natural disasters in recent history, with thousands of people killed and many more injured or displaced.

# Tectonic Setting

## Geology

The region affected by the earthquakes is located at the boundary between the Arabian and Anatolian tectonic plates. This boundary is a zone of complex deformation, where the Arabian plate is being pushed northwards into the Anatolian plate. The resulting stress has created a series of faults, including the East Anatolian Fault Zone, which runs for over 500 km (310 miles) across eastern Turkey.

## Seismicity

The region has a long history of seismic activity, with many significant earthquakes occurring in recent centuries. The East Anatolian Fault Zone is considered one of the most seismically active regions in the world, with frequent earthquakes occurring along its length. The earthquakes that struck in 2023 were not unexpected, given the region's geological history and ongoing tectonic activity.

# Earthquake Sequence

## Aftershocks

The initial earthquake, which occurred at 04:17 local time on February 6, was followed by numerous aftershocks, including several of significant magnitude. The aftershocks continued for several days, causing further damage and disruption. The most significant aftershock occurred on February 20, with a magnitude of 6.4.

## Seismology

The earthquakes were characterized by a high level of seismic energy release, with the initial earthquake having a magnitude of 7.8. The earthquakes were shallow, with focal depths of around 10-20 km (6-12 miles), which increased the level of damage and destruction.

## Rupture Propagation

The earthquakes were caused by rupture along the East Anatolian Fault Zone, with the initial earthquake rupturing a section of the fault approximately 100 km (62 miles) long. The rupture propagation was complex, with multiple branches and segments of the fault being activated.

## Surface Rupture

The earthquakes caused significant surface rupture, with the ground surface being broken and deformed along the length of the fault. The surface rupture was visible in many areas, with cracks and fissures opening up in the ground.

## Ground Motion

The earthquakes caused intense ground motion, with peak ground accelerations of up to 1g (9.8 m/s^2) recorded in some areas. The ground motion was strong enough to cause widespread damage and collapse of buildings.

## Geological Effects

The earthquakes caused significant geological effects, including landslides, soil liquefaction, and changes to the groundwater table. The earthquakes also caused the formation of sand blows and mud volcanoes in some areas.

## Tsunami

There were reports of a tsunami being triggered by the earthquakes, with waves of up to 1 meter (3.3 feet) high reported in some coastal areas. However, the tsunami was not widespread and did not cause significant damage.

## Effects on Other Faults

The earthquakes caused stress changes on other faults in the region, including the North Anatolian Fault Zone. The stress changes increased the likelihood of future earthquakes on these faults.

# Damage and Casualties

## In Turkey

The earthquakes caused widespread destruction in Turkey, with thousands of buildings collapsed or damaged. The city of Kahramanmaraş was particularly affected, with over 80% of buildings destroyed. The earthquakes also caused significant damage to infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and utilities.

## In Syria

The earthquakes caused significant damage and destruction in Syria, particularly in the northern regions. The city of Aleppo was severely affected, with many buildings collapsed or damaged.

## Foreign Casualties

There were reports of foreign casualties, particularly among tourists and aid workers. Several countries, including the United States, Russia, and China, reported casualties among their citizens.

## Effects in Other Countries

The earthquakes were felt in several other countries, including Lebanon, Jordan, and Israel. The earthquakes caused some damage and disruption in these countries, but the effects were generally minor.

## Aftershocks

The aftershocks caused further damage and disruption, particularly in areas already affected by the initial earthquake.

## Estimations of Losses

The estimated losses from the earthquakes were significant, with the Turkish government estimating damages of over $10 billion. The Syrian government estimated losses of over $5 billion.

# Aftermath

## Turkey

### Search and Rescue

Search and rescue efforts were launched immediately after the earthquakes, with teams from Turkey and around the world working to locate and rescue survivors. The search and rescue efforts were challenged by the scale of the disaster and the difficulty of accessing affected areas.

### Charity and Volunteer Campaigns

Charity and volunteer campaigns were launched to support those affected by the earthquakes. Many organizations, including the Turkish Red Crescent, worked to provide aid and assistance to survivors.

### Government Assistance

The Turkish government provided assistance to those affected by the earthquakes, including financial support and temporary housing.

### Incidents

There were several incidents of looting and violence in the aftermath of the earthquakes, particularly in areas where aid was slow to arrive.

### Crime and Conflict

The earthquakes exacerbated existing social and economic tensions in Turkey, leading to increased crime and conflict in some areas.

### Floods

Heavy rainfall in the days following the earthquakes caused flooding in some areas, further exacerbating the humanitarian crisis.

### 2023 Elections

The earthquakes had significant implications for the 2023 Turkish general election, with the government's response to the disaster becoming a major campaign issue.

### Education

The earthquakes caused significant disruption to education in affected areas, with many schools damaged or destroyed.

### Sports

The earthquakes had a significant impact on sports in Turkey, with several major sporting events cancelled or postponed.

## Syria

The earthquakes had a significant impact on Syria, particularly in areas already affected by the ongoing civil war. The Syrian government struggled to respond to the disaster, with aid slow to arrive in many areas.

# International Humanitarian Efforts

## Countries

Many countries provided humanitarian aid and assistance to Turkey and Syria in the aftermath of the earthquakes. The United States, Russia, and China were among the countries to provide significant aid.

## Arab League

The Arab League provided humanitarian aid and assistance to Syria, with several member states sending aid and rescue teams.

## ASEAN

The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) provided humanitarian aid and assistance to Turkey and Syria, with several member states sending aid and rescue teams.

## European Union (EU)

The European Union provided significant humanitarian aid and assistance to Turkey and Syria, with several member states sending aid and rescue teams.

## North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO)

NATO provided humanitarian aid and assistance to Turkey, with several member states sending aid and rescue teams.

## United Nations (UN)

The United Nations provided humanitarian aid and assistance to Turkey and Syria, with several agencies, including the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF), providing aid and support.

## World Bank

The World Bank provided financial assistance to Turkey and Syria, with several loans and grants approved to support reconstruction efforts.

article:
Killing of Amir Locke

The killing of Amir Locke was a fatal shooting that occurred on February 2, 2022, in Minneapolis, Minnesota, United States. Locke, a 22-year-old Black man, was shot and killed by a Minneapolis police officer during the execution of a no-knock search warrant. The incident sparked widespread outrage and protests, leading to calls for police reform and accountability.

# Background

## Persons involved

Amir Locke was a 22-year-old Black man who lived in Minneapolis. He was a licensed gun owner and worked as a part-time DoorDash driver. The Minneapolis police officer who shot Locke was Mark Hanneman, a 14-year veteran of the force. Hanneman was part of the SWAT team that executed the no-knock search warrant.

## Search warrant

The no-knock search warrant was obtained by the Minneapolis police department as part of a homicide investigation. The warrant was related to a case involving Locke's cousin, who was a suspect in a murder that occurred in January 2022. Police had obtained a warrant to search Locke's apartment, as well as several other locations, in an effort to gather evidence.

# Incident

On February 2, 2022, at approximately 6:48 a.m., the Minneapolis SWAT team executed the no-knock search warrant at Locke's apartment. Locke, who was not the target of the warrant, was asleep on the couch with a gun in his hand. When the police entered the apartment, Locke was startled and began to move. Officer Hanneman shot Locke three times, killing him. The entire incident was captured on body camera footage.

# Investigations

The Minnesota Bureau of Investigation (MBI) launched an investigation into the shooting, which is standard protocol for police-involved shootings in the state. The MBI reviewed body camera footage, interviewed witnesses, and collected physical evidence. The investigation was later turned over to the Hennepin County Attorney's Office for review.

# No-knock warrant moratorium and restrictions

In response to the killing of Amir Locke, the Minneapolis City Council passed a resolution calling for a moratorium on no-knock warrants. The resolution also called for increased transparency and accountability in the use of no-knock warrants. Additionally, the Minneapolis Police Department announced new restrictions on the use of no-knock warrants, including requiring a written justification for the use of such warrants.

# Reaction

## Family

Locke's family was devastated by his death and expressed outrage at the police department's actions. Locke's mother, Karen Locke, stated that her son was "executed" by the police and called for justice. Locke's family also filed a civil lawsuit against the city of Minneapolis and the police department.

## Officials

Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey and Police Chief Medaria Arradondo expressed condolences to Locke's family and promised a thorough investigation. However, they also faced criticism for their handling of the incident. Some officials called for greater transparency and accountability in the police department's use of force.

## Community groups

Community groups, including the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and the NAACP, condemned the killing of Amir Locke and called for police reform. These groups argued that the incident highlighted the need for greater accountability and transparency in the police department's use of force.

# Protests

## In Minneapolis—Saint Paul

Protests erupted in Minneapolis and Saint Paul in the days following Locke's death. Demonstrators called for justice and police reform, and some clashed with police. The protests were largely peaceful, but there were reports of property damage and arrests.

## Elsewhere

Protests also took place in other cities across the United States, including New York City, Los Angeles, and Chicago. These protests were part of a larger movement calling for police reform and accountability.

# Civil lawsuit

Locke's family filed a civil lawsuit against the city of Minneapolis and the police department, alleging that Locke's Fourth Amendment rights were violated. The lawsuit also alleged that the police department's use of force was excessive and that the department had a pattern of violating the rights of Black men.

# See also

* Police brutality in the United States
* Black Lives Matter
* Police reform in the United States

# External links

* Body camera footage of the incident (warning: graphic content)
* Minneapolis Police Department's statement on the incident
* Locke family's statement on the incident

The 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball Nations League was the fourth edition of the FIVB Volleyball Women's Nations League, an annual women's international volleyball tournament. The competition was contested by 16 national teams that qualified based on their performances in the previous edition of the tournament.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 FIVB Women's Volleyball Nations League was based on the teams' performances in the previous edition of the tournament. The top 12 teams from the 2021 edition qualified directly to the 2022 edition, while the remaining four spots were allocated to the top four teams from the 2021 FIVB Volleyball Women's Challenger Cup.

# Format

## Preliminary round

The 16 participating teams were divided into two pools of eight teams each. Each team played 12 matches, with the top five teams from each pool qualifying for the final round.

## Final round

The final round was contested by the top five teams from each pool, with the teams seeded based on their performances in the preliminary round. The final round consisted of quarterfinals, semifinals, and the final match.

# Rule changes

The FIVB introduced several rule changes for the 2022 edition of the Women's Nations League. One of the key changes was the introduction of a new scoring system, where a team must win by at least a two-point margin, unless the score is 25-23 or higher, in which case the team leading at that point wins the set.

The tournament was a double-elimination format, with four teams competing at each of the 16 regional sites. article:
All of Us Are Dead

All of Us Are Dead is a South Korean streaming television series based on the Naver webtoon of the same name by Joo Dong-geun. The series premiered on Netflix on January 28, 2022, and has received widespread critical acclaim for its unique take on the zombie apocalypse genre.

# Synopsis

The series is set in the fictional high school of Hyosan, where a group of students must navigate the challenges of adolescence amidst a rapidly spreading zombie outbreak. The story follows a diverse cast of characters as they try to survive and find a way to escape the school, which has been overrun by the undead. Along the way, they must confront their personal demons, form alliances, and make difficult choices to ensure their survival.

As the series progresses, the characters face numerous challenges, including the rapid spread of the zombie virus, the breakdown of social order, and the emergence of new threats in the form of other survivors. Throughout the series, the characters are forced to confront the harsh realities of their situation and make difficult choices to ensure their survival.

# Cast and characters

The story takes place several years after the events of the first film and sees Taylor facing a new challenge as he navigates the treacherous waters of the Mariana Trench. As he delves deeper into the ocean, he discovers a hidden world of massive sea creatures and must use his skills and knowledge to survive.

Sound design and mixing were completed in February 2022.

## Music

article:
94th Academy Awards

The 94th Academy Awards, popularly known as the Oscars, honored the best in film for 2021 and took place on March 27, 2022, at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California. The ceremony was broadcast on ABC and was hosted by Regina Hall, Amy Schumer, and Wanda Sykes.

#Winners and nominees

##Awards

The winners of the 94th Academy Awards were announced during the ceremony, with "CODA" winning the most prestigious award for Best Picture. The film's director, Sian Heder, also won the award for Best Adapted Screenplay. The award for Best Director went to Jane Campion for "The Power of the Dog", making her the third woman to win the award. Will Smith won the award for Best Actor for his role in "King Richard", while Jessica Chastain won the award for Best Actress for her role in "The Eyes of Tammy Faye".

The award for Best Supporting Actor went to Troy Kotsur for his role in "CODA", making him the first deaf male actor to win the award. The award for Best Supporting Actress went to Ariana DeBose for her role in "West Side Story". The award for Best Original Screenplay went to Kenneth Branagh for "Belfast", while the award for Best Cinematography went to Greig Fraser for "Dune".

##Governors Awards

###Honorary Academy Awards

The Honorary Academy Awards were presented to Danny Glover, Samuel L. Jackson, Elaine May, and Liv Ullmann for their contributions to the film industry.

###Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award

The Jean Hersholt Humanitarian Award was presented to Danny Glover for his philanthropic work.

##Films with multiple nominations and awards

Several films received multiple nominations, with "The Power of the Dog" and "Dune" leading the pack with 12 nominations each. "Belfast" and "West Side Story" both received 7 nominations, while "King Richard" and "CODA" both received 3 nominations. "Dune" won the most awards, with 6 wins, including Best Cinematography and Best Visual Effects.

#Presenters and performers

The ceremony featured several presenters and performers, including Lady Gaga, Chris Rock, and Kevin Hart. The ceremony also featured a performance by Beyoncé, who sang "Be Alive" from the film "King Richard".

#Ceremony information

##Rule and eligibility period changes

The Academy made several changes to the rules and eligibility period for the 94th Academy Awards. The eligibility period was extended to include films released from March 1, 2021, to December 31, 2021. The Academy also introduced a new rule requiring all films to be shown in a qualifying run in a commercial theater for at least a week to be eligible for consideration.

##Removal of categories from the broadcast

The Academy announced that it would be removing several categories from the live broadcast, including the awards for Best Editing, Best Sound, and Best Production Design. The winners of these awards would be announced during a pre-recorded segment that would be shown during the ceremony.

##Chris Rock–Will Smith slapping incident

During the ceremony, Chris Rock made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's hair, which led to Will Smith walking on stage and slapping Rock. Smith later apologized for his actions, stating that he had overreacted. The incident dominated the headlines and sparked a heated debate about violence and celebrity behavior.

##Critical reviews

The ceremony received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising the hosts and the performances, while others criticized the pacing and the removal of categories from the broadcast.

##Ratings and reception

The ceremony was watched by an estimated 16.6 million viewers, making it one of the lowest-rated Oscars ceremonies in history. The ceremony received a mixed reception on social media, with some viewers praising the winners and the performances, while others criticized the incident between Rock and Smith.

##"In Memoriam"

The ceremony included an "In Memoriam" segment, which paid tribute to several film industry professionals who had passed away in the past year, including Sidney Poitier, Peter Bogdanovich, and Helen Mirren.

article:
Campbell's Soup Cans is a iconic series of silkscreen prints created by American artist Andy Warhol in 1962. The work is a quintessential representation of the Pop Art movement, which celebrated the familiarity and ubiquity of consumer culture.

#Early career

Andy Warhol's early career as an artist was marked by his work as a commercial illustrator in New York City. Warhol moved to New York in 1949 and quickly established himself as a prominent figure in the city's art scene.

##New York art scene

Warhol's involvement in the New York art scene was instrumental in shaping his artistic style and interests. He was particularly drawn to the city's vibrant commercial art scene, where he worked as an illustrator for various magazines, including Vogue and Harper's Bazaar.

##Pop art

Warhol's work in the 1960s was heavily influenced by the emerging Pop Art movement. Pop Art was a reaction against the abstract expressionism that dominated the art world at the time, instead focusing on the everyday, the mundane, and the mass-produced. Warhol was fascinated by the ways in which consumer culture was shaping American society, and he saw the Campbell's Soup Can as an iconic representation of this phenomenon.

#Premiere

Campbell's Soup Cans premiered at the Ferus Gallery in Los Angeles in 1962. The exhibition was a groundbreaking event in the art world, with many critics and collectors responding with shock and confusion to Warhol's bold and unapologetic celebration of consumer culture.

##Subsequent publicity

The exhibition generated a significant amount of publicity, with many newspapers and magazines publishing reviews and feature articles about Warhol's work. The attention surrounding the exhibition helped to establish Warhol as a major figure in the art world, and Campbell's Soup Cans quickly became an iconic representation of the Pop Art movement.

#Campbell's Soup Company

Campbell's Soup Company was founded in 1869 by Joseph A. Campbell and Abraham Anderson. The company quickly established itself as a leading manufacturer of canned soups and other food products.

##Can and label history

Campbell's Soup Company has a long history of innovative packaging design. The company's iconic red and white can design was introduced in the 1890s and has remained largely unchanged to this day. Warhol was particularly drawn to the simplicity and familiarity of the Campbell's Soup Can design, seeing it as an iconic representation of American consumer culture.

##Relation to Warhol's art

Warhol's use of the Campbell's Soup Can as a subject was not simply a matter of chance. The artist was deeply interested in the ways in which consumer culture was shaping American society, and he saw the Campbell's Soup Can as an iconic representation of this phenomenon. Warhol's use of the Campbell's Soup Can also reflects his fascination with the banal and the mundane, as well as his interest in exploring the relationship between high art and popular culture.

#Inspiration

Warhol's inspiration for Campbell's Soup Cans came from a variety of sources. The artist was particularly drawn to the work of comic strip artists and illustrators, as well as the advertising and packaging design that filled the streets and magazines of New York City.

##Artist colleagues

Warhol's work was also influenced by his relationships with other artists and musicians. The artist was a key figure in the New York City art scene, and he was friends with many of the leading figures of the time, including Jasper Johns, Robert Rauschenberg, and Edie Sedgwick.

#Interpretation

Campbell's Soup Cans has been interpreted in a variety of ways by art critics and historians. Some have seen the work as a commentary on the banality and superficiality of consumer culture, while others have interpreted it as a celebration of the familiar and the mundane.

#Variations

Warhol created numerous variations of Campbell's Soup Cans throughout his career. Some of these variations feature different flavors of soup, while others feature the same flavor in different colors or arrangements.

##Campbell's Soup I and Campbell's Soup Cans II

Warhol's first series of silkscreen prints, Campbell's Soup I, was created in 1962. The series featured 10 different flavors of soup, each in a different arrangement. The second series, Campbell's Soup Cans II, was created in 1963 and featured 200 different silkscreen prints, each with a different flavor of soup.

##Colored soup cans

In the late 1960s, Warhol began creating colored versions of the Campbell's Soup Can. These works feature the same iconic design as the original black and white prints, but with a range of bright, bold colors.

##Unauthorized versions

Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans have been widely imitated and parodied over the years. Many artists and designers have created their own versions of the work, often without permission from Warhol or his estate.

##Other variations

Warhol also created numerous other variations of Campbell's Soup Cans, including sculptures, prints, and even a series of Campbell's Soup Can-shaped cookie jars.

#Conclusion

Campbell's Soup Cans is a iconic series of silkscreen prints that has become synonymous with the Pop Art movement. Warhol's use of the Campbell's Soup Can as a subject was a bold and unapologetic celebration of consumer culture, and the work continues to be widely admired and imitated today.

article:
Artemis I
================

The Artemis I mission is an uncrewed spaceflight mission conducted by NASA as part of the Artemis program, aimed at returning humans to the lunar surface by 2025. The mission serves as a critical step in testing the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, the Orion spacecraft, and the ground systems necessary for future crewed missions to the Moon.

Mission Profile
--------------

The Artemis I mission profile is designed to simulate the trajectory and conditions that a crewed mission to the Moon would encounter. The mission will send the Orion spacecraft on a lunar flyby, followed by a return to Earth, demonstrating the spacecraft's ability to withstand the harsh conditions of space travel and re-entry into the Earth's atmosphere.

### Mission Profile Animation

NASA has released an animated video illustrating the Artemis I mission profile, showcasing the spacecraft's journey from launch to splashdown. The animation provides a detailed visualization of the mission's critical phases, including launch, trans-lunar injection, lunar flyby, and re-entry.

Background
----------

The Artemis I mission is the culmination of years of development and testing of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket and the Orion spacecraft.

### Ground Testing

Ground testing of the SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft began in 2014 and continued through 2020. The testing campaign included a series of critical tests, such as the SLS rocket's core stage hot fire test and the Orion spacecraft's Ascent Abort-2 test.

### Assembly

The final assembly of the SLS rocket and Orion spacecraft took place at the Kennedy Space Center's Vehicle Assembly Building (VAB). The rocket's core stage was integrated with the solid rocket boosters, while the Orion spacecraft was mated to the rocket's Interim Cryogenic Propulsion Stage (ICPS).

### Launch Preparations

Launch preparations for Artemis I began in 2021, with the rocket and spacecraft undergoing final checks and preparations at the Kennedy Space Center's Launch Complex 39B.

### Initial Launch Attempts

The initial launch attempt for Artemis I was scheduled for August 29, 2022, but was scrubbed due to technical issues. A second launch attempt was made on September 3, 2022, but was also scrubbed due to a fuel leak. The rocket and spacecraft were rolled back to the VAB for repairs and further testing.

Flight
------

The Artemis I mission launched on November 16, 2022, at 1:47 AM EST, from the Kennedy Space Center's Launch Complex 39B.

### Launch

The SLS rocket lifted off from the launch pad, carrying the Orion spacecraft on a 26-day journey to the Moon and back. The rocket's solid rocket boosters separated from the core stage after two minutes, followed by the jettisoning of the launch abort system.

### Outbound Flight

The Orion spacecraft entered into a lunar flyby trajectory, traveling more than 280,000 miles from Earth. The spacecraft performed a series of course corrections and engine burns to ensure a precise lunar flyby.

### Lunar Orbit

The Orion spacecraft flew within 4,000 miles of the lunar surface, testing the spacecraft's navigation and communication systems. The spacecraft captured stunning images of the lunar surface, including the Moon's south pole and the Apollo 11 landing site.

### Return Flight

The Orion spacecraft began its return journey to Earth, using the Moon's gravity to slingshot the spacecraft back towards the planet. The spacecraft performed a series of engine burns to slow its velocity and prepare for re-entry.

### Reentry and Splashdown

The Orion spacecraft re-entered the Earth's atmosphere, reaching temperatures of up to 5,000 degrees Fahrenheit. The spacecraft deployed its drogue parachute and main parachutes, slowing its descent to a splashdown in the Pacific Ocean.

Payloads
--------

The Artemis I mission carried a total of 13 payloads, including cubesats and experiments.

### Cubesats

Ten cubesats were launched on the Artemis I mission, including the Near-Earth Asteroid Scout, the Lunar Trailblazer, and the BioSentinel. These small satellites will conduct a range of scientific experiments, including asteroid detection and lunar resource utilization.

Media Outreach
--------------

NASA conducted an extensive media outreach campaign for the Artemis I mission, including press conferences, social media events, and live coverage of the launch.

See Also
--------

* Artemis program
* Space Launch System
* Orion spacecraft
* Lunar Gateway

Notes
-----

The Artemis I mission marked a critical step in NASA's plans to return humans to the lunar surface by 2025.

----------

article:
2022 Australian Federal Election

The 2022 Australian federal election was held on 21 May 2022 to elect members of the 47th Parliament of Australia. The election was called following the dissolution of the 46th Parliament, and resulted in a change of government with the Australian Labor Party (ALP) led by Anthony Albanese winning a majority of seats in the House of Representatives.

#Background

##Previous election

The previous federal election was held on 18 May 2019, which resulted in the Liberal Party of Australia led by Scott Morrison winning a third consecutive term in government. The election saw a significant swing against the ALP, with the party failing to win a majority of seats in the House of Representatives.

##Composition of parliament

Prior to the 2022 election, the 46th Parliament consisted of 151 members in the House of Representatives and 76 senators in the Senate. The Liberal Party held 75 seats in the House of Representatives, with the ALP holding 69 seats. The remaining seven seats were held by independents and minor parties. In the Senate, the Liberal Party held 31 seats, with the ALP holding 26 seats.

##Events of the 46th Parliament

The 46th Parliament was marked by several significant events, including the COVID-19 pandemic, which had a major impact on the country's economy and healthcare system. The government's response to the pandemic was a major issue during the parliament, with the ALP criticizing the government's handling of the crisis. Other significant events during the parliament included the 2019-2020 bushfire season, which had a major impact on the country's environment and wildlife.

##Change in party registration rules

In 2021, the Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) introduced new rules for party registration, which required parties to have a minimum of 1,500 members to be eligible for registration. The change was intended to reduce the number of minor parties contesting federal elections.

##Party preselection issues

In the lead-up to the election, several parties experienced issues with preselection, including the Liberal Party and the ALP. Several sitting members of parliament were challenged for preselection, with some losing their endorsement.

##Independents

Several independents contested the election, including some high-profile candidates. The independents were seen as a major threat to the major parties, particularly in marginal seats.

#Electoral system

Australia uses a compulsory preferential voting system for federal elections. In the House of Representatives, voters are required to rank candidates in order of preference, with the candidate with the lowest number of first-preference votes being eliminated and their preferences being redistributed to other candidates. In the Senate, voters can choose to vote above the line or below the line, with above-the-line votes being allocated to parties according to their preference tickets.

#State of electorates

##Redistribution

Prior to the election, a redistribution of electoral boundaries was conducted, which resulted in changes to several electorates. The redistribution was intended to reflect changes in population and demographic trends.

##Election pendulum (House of Representatives)

The election pendulum is a measure of the number of seats that would need to change hands for a party to win a majority of seats in the House of Representatives. Prior to the election, the pendulum suggested that the ALP needed to win a net gain of seven seats to win a majority.

#Voter registration

Voter registration is compulsory in Australia, with all eligible citizens required to be enrolled to vote. The AEC reported that over 17 million Australians were enrolled to vote in the 2022 election.

#Election date

##Dissolution of parliament

The 46th Parliament was dissolved on 11 April 2022, with the Governor-General, David Hurley, issuing a proclamation calling the election.

#Election timeline

* 11 April 2022: The 46th Parliament is dissolved, and the election is called.
* 18 April 2022: Nominations for candidates close.
* 21 May 2022: The election is held.

#Campaign events

##Leaders' debates

Several leaders' debates were held during the campaign, including a debate between Scott Morrison and Anthony Albanese.

##Campaign

The campaign was marked by several significant events, including the release of the parties' election policies and the announcement of major campaign promises.

##Preferences

The allocation of preferences was a major issue during the campaign, with several parties announcing that they would direct preferences to other parties.

#Candidates

##Parties

Several parties contested the election, including the Liberal Party, the ALP, the Greens, and several minor parties.

#Retiring members

##Labor

Several Labor members of parliament announced their retirement prior to the election, including Wayne Swan and Anthony Byrne.

##Liberal

Several Liberal members of parliament announced their retirement prior to the election, including Julie Bishop and Christopher Pyne.

##Nationals

Several Nationals members of parliament announced their retirement prior to the election, including Nigel Scullion.

#Opinion polling

Opinion polling during the campaign suggested that the ALP was ahead of the Liberal Party, with the party's primary vote increasing significantly.

#Newspaper endorsements

##Weekend editions

Several weekend editions of newspapers endorsed the ALP, including the Sydney Morning Herald and The Age.

##Metropolitan daily newspapers

Several metropolitan daily newspapers endorsed the Liberal Party, including The Australian and the Daily Telegraph.

##Online publications

Several online publications endorsed the ALP, including Crikey and The Conversation.

##Regional newspapers

Several regional newspapers endorsed the Nationals, including the Queensland Country Life and the Western Magazine.

#Results

##House of Representatives

The ALP won a majority of seats in the House of Representatives, with the party winning 78 seats to the Liberal Party's 58.

##Senate

The ALP won 26 seats in the Senate, with the Liberal Party winning 25 seats.

#Seats changing hands

Several seats changed hands during the election, including several marginal seats.

#Maps

A number of electoral maps were produced during the campaign, including maps showing the distribution of seats and the margin of victory in each electorate.

#Aftermath and reactions

##Domestic reactions

The election result was met with a range of reactions from domestic commentators, with some praising the ALP's victory and others criticizing the Liberal Party's performance.

##International reactions

The election result was met with interest from international commentators, with several countries congratulating the ALP on its victory.

#See also

* 2022 Australian federal election (Senate)
* 2022 Australian federal election (House of Representatives)
* Australian federal election, 2019

#Notes

article:
Atomic Clock

An atomic clock is a type of clock that uses the vibrations of atoms to measure time. These clocks are the most accurate type of timekeeping device, with an error of only one second over tens of millions of years. Atomic clocks are used as reference points for modern civil time and have numerous applications in science, technology, and industry.

**History**

The development of atomic clocks began in the 1940s, with the first working model being constructed in 1950 by physicist Isidor Rabi and his colleagues at Columbia University. However, it was not until the 1960s that atomic clocks became widely used as timekeeping devices.

### Definition of the second

The second is the fundamental unit of time in the International System of Units (SI). In 1967, the 13th General Conference on Weights and Measures defined the second as the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium-133 atom. This definition was chosen because it was based on a physical phenomenon that could be reproduced with high accuracy.

### Metrology advancements and optical clocks

The development of optical clocks in the 1990s and 2000s revolutionized the field of metrology. Optical clocks use the vibrations of atoms or ions to measure time, which allows for even higher accuracy than traditional atomic clocks. These advancements have enabled scientists to study phenomena such as gravitational redshift and the variation of fundamental constants.

### Chip-scale atomic clocks

In recent years, researchers have developed chip-scale atomic clocks, which are small enough to be integrated into portable devices. These clocks have numerous potential applications, including navigation systems, telecommunications, and basic scientific research.

**Measuring time with atomic clocks**

Atomic clocks use the vibrations of atoms to measure time. The basic mechanism consists of a sample of atoms, a radiation source, and a detector.

### Clock mechanism

The clock mechanism works as follows: the sample of atoms is excited by the radiation source, which causes the atoms to vibrate at a specific frequency. The detector measures the frequency of these vibrations, which is used to generate a clock signal. The clock signal is then divided down to produce a time signal.

### Tuning and optimization

To achieve high accuracy, atomic clocks must be carefully tuned and optimized. This involves adjusting the radiation source, the sample of atoms, and the detector to achieve the highest possible frequency stability.

**Accuracy**

Atomic clocks are the most accurate type of timekeeping device, with an error of only one second over tens of millions of years. This accuracy is due to the fact that the vibrations of atoms are highly stable and can be measured with high precision.

**Comparing atomic clocks**

Atomic clocks are compared to each other to ensure that they are keeping accurate time. This is done by measuring the difference between the clock signals of two or more clocks.

### Time standards

The international time standard is Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), which is based on the average of over 200 atomic clocks located around the world. These clocks are compared to each other on a regular basis to ensure that they are keeping accurate time.

### Synchronization with satellites

Atomic clocks are also used to synchronize the clocks on satellites with the international time standard. This is done by comparing the clock signals of the satellite clocks with the signals from ground-based atomic clocks.

### International timekeeping

International timekeeping is coordinated by the International Earth Rotation and Reference Systems Service (IERS). The IERS is responsible for maintaining the international time standard and ensuring that it is consistent with the Earth's rotation.

### Fiber Optics

Fiber optics are used to compare atomic clocks over long distances. This is done by sending a laser signal through a fiber optic cable and measuring the time difference between the signal and the clock signal.

**Microwave atomic clocks**

Microwave atomic clocks use the vibrations of atoms to measure time in the microwave frequency range.

### Caesium

Caesium atomic clocks are the most common type of microwave atomic clock. They use the vibrations of caesium-133 atoms to measure time.

#### Block diagram

A block diagram of a caesium atomic clock is shown below:
```
+---------------+
|  Radiation  |
|  Source     |
+---------------+
       |
       |
       v
+---------------+
|  Sample of  |
|  Caesium-133 |
|  Atoms      |
+---------------+
       |
       |
       v
+---------------+
|  Detector    |
+---------------+
       |
       |
       v
+---------------+
|  Clock Signal|
+---------------+
```
### Rubidium

Rubidium atomic clocks are another type of microwave atomic clock. They use the vibrations of rubidium-87 atoms to measure time.

### Hydrogen

Hydrogen atomic clocks use the vibrations of hydrogen-1 atoms to measure time.

**Other types of atomic clocks**

There are several other types of atomic clocks, including quantum clocks and nuclear clocks.

### Quantum clocks

Quantum clocks use the principles of quantum mechanics to measure time. They are still in the early stages of development but have the potential to be even more accurate than traditional atomic clocks.

### Nuclear clock concept

The nuclear clock concept uses the vibrations of the nucleus to measure time. This concept is still in the early stages of development but has the potential to be even more accurate than traditional atomic clocks.

**Potential for redefining the second**

The development of new types of atomic clocks has raised the possibility of redefining the second.

### Rydberg constant

The Rydberg constant is a fundamental constant that is used to define the second. However, recent measurements have shown that the Rydberg constant may not be as constant as previously thought.

### Requirements

Any new definition of the second would need to meet certain requirements, including high accuracy and stability.

### Secondary representations of the second

Secondary representations of the second are used to realize the international time standard. These representations are based on the average of multiple atomic clocks.

**Applications**

Atomic clocks have numerous applications in science, technology, and industry.

### Global navigation satellite systems

Atomic clocks are used in global navigation satellite systems such as GPS and GLONASS.

#### Experimental space clock

The experimental space clock is a clock that is being developed for use on satellites. It will use a combination of atomic clocks and optical clocks to achieve high accuracy.

#### Military usage

Atomic clocks are used by the military for navigation and communication.

### Time signal radio transmitters

Time signal radio transmitters use atomic clocks to broadcast a time signal.

### General relativity

Atomic clocks are used to test the predictions of general relativity.

### Financial systems

Atomic clocks are used in financial systems to timestamp transactions.

### Transportable Optical Clocks

Transportable optical clocks are clocks that can be transported and used in different locations. They have numerous potential applications, including navigation systems and basic scientific research.

* SI: International System of Units

article:
Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva

Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language fantasy adventure film written and directed by Ayan Mukerji, and produced by Karan Johar, Apoorva Mehta, Namit Malhotra, and Mukerji under the banners Dharma Productions, Prime Focus, and Starlight Pictures in association with Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures and 20th Century Studios. The film is the first installment in the Brahmāstra trilogy, and it stars Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, Mouni Roy, and Nagarjuna Akkineni.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Shiva (Ranbir Kapoor), a young man with a mysterious past who discovers that he has the power to control fire. As he embarks on a journey to uncover the truth about his past and his powers, he meets Isha (Alia Bhatt), a young woman who becomes his love interest. Together, they team up with Junoon (Mouni Roy), a dark sorceress, and Anish Shetty (Nagarjuna Akkineni), a scientist, to prevent the destruction of the world.

# Cast

* Ranbir Kapoor as Shiva
* Alia Bhatt as Isha
* Mouni Roy as Junoon
* Nagarjuna Akkineni as Anish Shetty
* Amitabh Bachchan as Raghu
* Dimple Kapadia as Savitri
* Divyendu Sharma as Zorawar
* Saurav Gurjar as Zalnawar
* Gurfateh Pirzada as Dimple
* Lehar Khan as Rukmini

# Production

## Development

The idea for Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva was conceived by Ayan Mukerji in 2011. Mukerji was inspired by Indian mythology and wanted to create a film that would showcase the country's rich cultural heritage. The film was initially titled "Dragon" and was supposed to be a romantic drama. However, as the script developed, Mukerji decided to incorporate elements of fantasy and adventure.

## Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in 2015. Mukerji worked with a team of writers to develop the script, and the film's budget was estimated to be around ₹100 crore. However, the budget eventually increased to ₹410 crore, making it one of the most expensive Indian films ever made.

## Themes

The film explores several themes, including love, friendship, and the struggle between good and evil. The film also delves into the concept of astras, which are divine weapons from Hindu mythology. The film's title, Brahmāstra, refers to the most powerful astra in Hindu mythology, which is said to have the power to destroy the universe.

## Characters

The film features a diverse cast of characters, each with their own unique backstory and motivations. Shiva, the protagonist, is a complex character with a mysterious past. Isha, the female lead, is a strong and independent character who becomes Shiva's love interest. Junoon, the antagonist, is a dark sorceress with a hidden agenda.

## Filming

Principal photography on the film began in February 2018 and wrapped up in March 2022. The film was shot in various locations across India, including Mumbai, Delhi, and Varanasi. The film's action sequences were choreographed by Yuen Woo-ping, a renowned action director from Hong Kong.

## Post-production

Post-production on the film began in 2020. The film's visual effects were handled by DNEG, a leading visual effects company from the UK. The film's music was composed by Pritam, a renowned music composer from India.

# Music

The film's soundtrack features six tracks, including "Kesariya", "Deva Deva", and "Rasiya". The music was composed by Pritam, and the lyrics were written by Amitabh Bhattacharya.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in 2020. The film's trailer was released in December 2021, and it received a mixed response from audiences. The film's posters and promotional materials were designed by a team of graphic designers from India and abroad.

# Release

## Theatrical

Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva was released theatrically on September 9, 2022. The film was released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, and Kannada. The film received a wide release in India and abroad, with over 5,000 screens dedicated to the film.

## Controversy

The film was surrounded by controversy even before its release. The film's title, Brahmāstra, was criticized by some Hindu groups, who claimed that it was an insult to Hindu mythology. The film's makers were also accused of cultural appropriation and plagiarism.

## Home media

The film was released on home media platforms, including DVD, Blu-ray, and digital streaming platforms, in November 2022.

# Reception

## Critical response

### India

The film received mixed reviews from Indian critics. Some critics praised the film's visuals and action sequences, while others criticized the film's script and characters.

### International

The film received generally positive reviews from international critics. Some critics praised the film's unique blend of Indian mythology and fantasy, while others criticized the film's pacing and plot.

## Box office

The film performed well at the box office, grossing over ₹430 crore worldwide. The film became one of the highest-grossing Indian films of all time, and it helped to establish the Brahmāstra franchise as a major player in the Indian film industry.

# Accolades

The film won several awards, including the Filmfare Award for Best Visual Effects and the IIFA Award for Best Action.

# Future

## Sequel

A sequel to the film, titled Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev, is currently in development. The film is expected to be released in 2025.

## Streaming television series

A streaming television series, titled Brahmāstra: The Series, is currently in development. The series will be a spin-off of the film and will explore the backstory of the characters.

## Spin-off

A spin-off film, titled Junoon: The Rise of the Dark Sorceress, is currently in development. The film will explore the backstory of the antagonist, Junoon.

# Notes

The film's title, Brahmāstra, refers to the most powerful astra in Hindu mythology. The film's makers consulted with experts in Hindu mythology to ensure that the film's depiction of astras was accurate.
